entry.title: What I Learned Writing My First Ruby Gem
entry.content:
Lorem ipsum dolor sit ammet…

So I ended with an API like this:

```ruby client = Marvelite::API::Client.new( :public_key => ‘abcd’, :private_key => ‘1234’ )

fetch a character:

client.character(900126)

but, who knows what id to use to fetch

a character by name, so, this is more handy:

client.character(‘Spider-Man’)

want a list of comics this character appears on?

sure, no problem:

client.character_comics(‘Spider-Man’) ```

```javascript var comicsApp = angular.module(‘comicsApp’, []);

// then you’ll configure the app… // part of this config will create a service named Comics // then we get to the controller, that will use this service: comicsApp.controller(‘ComicsListController’, [‘$scope’, ‘Comics’, function($scope, Comics) {

Comics.query().then(function(data) {
  $scope.comics = data;
});

}] ); ```
